Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the model provided: 1. R to P has an average of 25 hours and a STDEV of 1 hour. 2. P to N has an average of 7 days and STDEV 2 days. 3. A to C averages 2 hours with 1 hour STDEV. 4. E to N has an average of 5 minutes with 1 minute STDEV.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For the hypotheses on why these happen. Let me think of possible reasons: System Errors or Bypassed Steps. Manual Data Entry Delays. Resource Constraints. Automated Processes. Data Entry Issues. Customer-Specific Issues. Process Variance.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For each pair of activities, we can calculate the time difference between their timestamps and check against the models expected avg and stdev. For each claim, find the earliest event of ACT1. Then find the next occurrence of ACT2 after that ACT1 event. Calculate the time difference.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The low STDEV in R-P suggests most are close to that average. For A to C, assigning a claim and then closing it within 2 hours seems too fast. For E to N, evaluation should take longer than a few minutes. For P to N, 7 days seems excessive unless theres a backlog.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: To verify, select claims where the R-P time is within the expected range but check if other steps are missing. Compute the z-score or check if more than 2 standard deviations from the mean. Use EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (P_time - R_time)) as time_diff_seconds.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Wait, the models average is 90000 seconds, STDEV 3600. 2 standard deviations 7200, range 82800 to 97200. For A to C, 7200 - 7200 = 0 to 14400 seconds. Adjust the WHERE clause for lower bound being 0.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For R to P: Automated approval without proper validation. For P to N: Notification system delayed or backlog. For A to C: Closed without evaluation. For E to N: Automated tool without review.
